intro: Ouratea monantha, commonly known as the white-flowered ouratea, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically has smooth, grayish bark and elliptical, glossy leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
